rules: Rule1: Either game technology creates innovative jobs or it outsources innovative jobs.
Rule2: Under the condition that game technology outsources innovative jobs, Region Alpha does not subsidize job grants.
Rule3: If Legislation Beta restricts Facility Gamma, then Legislation Beta does not ban Facility Gamma.

Rule4: Facility Gamma expands its operations, or if it is not the case that game technology creating innovative jobs implies Region Alpha does not subsidize job grants, then Legislation Beta restricts Facility Gamma.
Rule5: Facility Gamma relocates to Region Beta, or if Facility Gamma expands its operations then it hires locals.
Rule6: Either Region Alpha promotes game technology or Region Alpha taxes game technology.
Rule7: Under the condition that Region Alpha taxes game technology, Facility Gamma does not operate in Region Alpha.
Rule8: Provided that Legislation Beta amends the incentive act, then if Region Alpha promotes game technology, Region Alpha attracts investment.

Rule9: Legislation Beta accelerates implementation, or if it is not the case that the governor signing the incentive act implies the governor vetoes the incentive act, then Legislation Beta delays implementation.

Rule10: Facility Gamma operates in Region Alpha, or if it is not the case that game technology not existing implies Region Alpha does not invest in game technology, then Legislation Beta approves job grants.
Rule11: If Legislation Beta supports Facility Gamma, then Facility Gamma does not operate in Region Alpha.
Rule12: Under the condition that Legislation Beta opposes Facility Gamma, Facility Gamma does not operate in Region Alpha.
Rule13: If Legislation Beta regulates game technology, then Legislation Beta either supports Facility Gamma or opposes Facility Gamma.
Rule14: Provided that Region Alpha enforces regulation, then Legislation Beta regulates game technology.
Rule15: Region Alpha enforces regulation, or Region Alpha challenges regulation.
Rule16: If Region Alpha challenges regulation, then Legislation Beta regulates game technology.
Rule17: If it is not the case that game technology creating innovative jobs implies Region Alpha does not subsidize job grants, then Legislation Beta bans Facility Gamma.
Rule18: If it is not the case that Legislation Beta passing the incentive act implies it amends the incentive act, then the governor signs the incentive act.
Rule19: If it is not the case that the governor signing the incentive act implies the governor vetoes the incentive act, then Legislation Beta does not delay implementation.

Rule20: Under the condition that it is not the case that the union lobbies Legislation Beta or the union protests job grants or if game technology does not exist then Region Alpha does not invest in game technology, then the union strikes Facility Gamma.

Rule21: Provided that it is not the case that the union lobbies Legislation Beta or the union protests job grants or if game technology does not exist then Region Alpha does not invest in game technology, then the union does not strike Facility Gamma.
Rule22: Under the condition that it is not the case that game technology not existing implies Region Alpha does not invest in game technology, then Region Alpha subsidizes job grants.
Rule23: Provided that it is not the case that game technology not existing implies Region Alpha does not invest in game technology, then Legislation Beta does not approve job grants.
Rule24: If game technology does not exist, then Region Alpha invests in game technology.
facts: Fact1: Legislation Beta passes the incentive act.
Fact2: Facility Gamma does not hire locals.
Fact3: Facility Gamma does not relocate to Region Beta.
Fact4: Region Alpha does not attract investment.
Fact5: The governor does not veto the incentive act.
Fact6: It is not the case that Legislation Beta accelerates implementation.
Fact7: The union does not protest job grants.
Fact8: The union does not lobby Legislation Beta.
